Texto: 
physical exam:
afebrile. bp 130/80. hr 84. rr 20. 
abd: mildly tender left upper quadrant to palpation.

labs: 
ua: gross blood. no leukocytes, nitrites. 
h/h: 13/39.
if symptomatic, angiographic embolization with ethanol. nephrectomy is reserved for cases refractory to embolization.
1) axial ct image, left kidney upper pole: mass of enhancing, dilated, corkscrew, varicose-like vascular structures in the corticomedullary parenchyma of the left kidney approximating the renal sinus fat and central kidney collecting system.
2) axial ct image, left kidney upper pole: feeding artery is consistent with renal avm, congenital type.
3) axial ct image, left kidney upper pole: varicose draining vein is consistent with renal avm, congenital type.
renal arteriovenous malformation, congenital - cirsoid type
1) congenital renal avm, cirsoid type
2) congenital renal avm, cavernous type
3) acquired renal av fistula, posttraumatic v iatrogenic
44 year old female with no pmhx presents with left flank pain and gross hematuria.
very classic masslike, varicose appearance of cirsoid type congenital renal avm.
